stadium.name: The Glowstone Terrace
stadium.description: A massive, opulent stadium built on one of the city's main terraces, carved directly into the mountainside. The field is famously paved with polished Glowstone, and the stands overlook the bustling Confluence Market and the ongoing construction of the Guild's Skyport.

stats.pregame_ritual: Doing a terrible, clumsy dance to 'loosen the joints'.
Chugging a raw egg, shell and all.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Arm-wrestling the player who plays the same position on their team.
Speaking only in rhymes for the hour before the game.
Rubbing the Trollball on their armpits for 'grip'.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Covering their forearms in a sticky tree sap for 'grip'.
Eating a dandelion, stem and all.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).

stadium.name: The Sinking Field
stadium.description: A notoriously poorly-maintained stadium built on reclaimed marshland. The ground is unstable, often waterlogged, and sections of the stands are known to collapse.

stats.pregame_ritual: Seeing who on the team can belch the loudest.
Meditating silently in the corner of the locker room.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Daring a teammate to eat a live worm.
Thanking their armor for the protection it's about to offer.
Counting the number of clouds in the sky.
Tapping each piece of their armor in a specific sequence.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Singing a sea shanty completely out of tune.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Tapping each piece of their armor in a specific sequence.
Insisting on being the last player to leave the locker room.
Meditating silently in the corner of the locker room.
Daring a teammate to eat a live worm.

preGame:
üéôÔ∏è HELLO EVERYBODY, AND WELCOME TO THE SECOND LEG OF THIS GHASTLY POST-SEASON THRILLER! This is Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live from the nosebleed heights of **The Glowstone Terrace**! We are high up in the World‚Äôs Spine Mountains where the air is thin, the wind is howling, and the glare from these polished stones is enough to make even a demon‚Äôs eyes water! After that 6-0 drubbing in the swamp, my beloved **Ebon Gate Corruptors** find themselves with their backs against the wall in this Best of 3 series. It‚Äôs win or go home to the loser's bracket, folks! 

I‚Äôve been watching the pre-game festivities from the broadcast booth, and the atmosphere is positively corporate! We‚Äôve got Guild members everywhere, probably calculating their profits while players lose their teeth. I spotted **Smith Syst** of the Corruptors out there on the field‚Äîshe just dared a teammate to eat a live worm, and by the gods, she did it herself first! Talk about grit! Meanwhile, over in the Captains' huddle, **Ladew Evelina** is chugging another raw egg. I haven‚Äôt seen a stomach that strong since Morgwae tried to cook for Sir Tanos! 

The **Confluence Captains** are looking smug with their 1-0 series lead, but the mountain wind is picking up, and the Market Day crowd is reaching a fever pitch. Will the polished floors and the 'Glowstone Glare' be too much for our boys from the Gate, or will they find a way to drag these mountain-dwellers down into the muck where they belong? Grab your spirits, keep your helmets tight, and let‚Äôs get ready for some playoff carnage! üèüÔ∏èüèêüí®
postGame:
üéôÔ∏è HOLY SMOKE, WHAT A DEFENSIVE MASTERCLASS‚ÄîOR A SPECTACULAR DISPLAY OF CLUMSY VIOLENCE! I'm not sure which! The whistle has blown, the glowstones are stained red, and the **Confluence Captains** have punched their ticket to the next round with a 1-0 overtime victory! It‚Äôs a heartbreak for the **Ebon Gate Corruptors**, who fought like cornered rats but just couldn't find the basket. Let‚Äôs talk about this game, because it was a real grinder!

The match started with **Carnahan Laud** of the Captains snatching the ball in the Away Field. She looked ready to repeat her Game 1 heroics, but the Corruptors' defense was ready to play rough! **Smith Syst**‚Äîfresh off her worm-eating ritual‚Äîabsolutely leveled **Ladew Evelina**, sending that egg-chugging warrior straight to the healer‚Äôs tent! You could hear the crunch of armor from here, and I bet even Sir Garon Ironrock felt that one in his fancy chair!

As the game progressed, it turned into a chaotic scramble. **Ellette Paz** of my Corruptors was running like a bat out of the Demon Prison, advancing toward the goal with purpose! But then, **Vonni Geoff**‚Äîthat sap-covered scoundrel‚Äîcame out of nowhere and laid a tackle on Smith Syst that ended her afternoon early! It‚Äôs a shame, folks, truly a shame. These Captains play a dirty game for people who claim to be civilized!

The turnovers were flying faster than insults at a fey circus! **Judi Carrington** tried a long-range pass that was snatched right out of the air by **Richia Pazit**. Not to be outdone, **Vonni Geoff** tried his own pass only to have it intercepted right back by Carrington! It was like watching two toddlers fight over a toy, if the toddlers were armed with Kirkhammers and rapiers!

The violence really ramped up as the clock ticked down. **Ellette Paz** showed no mercy, injuring **Belding Chloe** with a blackjack to the ribs! But the Captains gave as good as they got. **Vonni Geoff** put **As Utter** into the dirt, and **Ladew Evelina**, returning from her earlier injury, absolutely flattened **Judi Carrington**! The medical staff is going to need a raise, or at least a very large bottle of Imra‚Äôs elixirs after this one!

By the end of regulation, the score stood at a deadlock: 0-0! Neither team could overcome the defense, the 'Glowstone Glare', or their own exhaustion. I saw **Ahasuerus An** trying to complete a pass to Ellette Paz, but the ball just slipped away. It was a tense, sweaty, and blood-soaked affair that sent us straight into the dreaded **OVERTIME**!

In the extra period, every heart in the stadium was pounding‚Äîexcept maybe for the Necromancer Toland, who I assume doesn't have one! **Caves Cestar** of the Captains managed to scoop up the ball in the Away 2-Point zone. The Corruptors' defense was gapped, and the fatigue was clearly setting in. 

Cestar saw his opening and he didn't miss! He charged through the mud-slicked glowstone, evaded a desperate last-ditch effort from the defense, and **DUNKS THE BALL INTO THE GOAL!** The crowd at Confluence went wild, and I‚Äôm fairly certain I saw Chairman Brennen Farno crack a smile‚Äîor maybe he just saw a gold coin on the floor. Either way, the Captains take the game 1-0 and the series 2-0!

I‚Äôm gutted for the Ebon Gate crew. They had the heart, they had the belching contests, but they just couldn't seal the deal. Now they head to the loser‚Äôs bracket to fight their way back up. Those Captains think they‚Äôre the kings of the mountain now, but let's see how they handle the higher-seeded teams in the next round! They‚Äôve got the Guild's backing, but they don't have the soul of the Gate!

Final Score: **The Confluence Captains 1, The Ebon Gate Corruptors 0 (OT)**. The Captains win the series 2-0 and move on! The Corruptors are headed to the loser's bracket. This has been Nok the Corrupter, mourning a loss but celebrating the bruises! Stay tuned for more Tuesday Night Trollball! üèêüíÄüèÜ
